item.title: [pi] jewlery enchanting & new crafting [pi] *fixed*
item.dc:creator: @thedolphin thedolphin
item.description:
@thedolphin wrote:

Hey, sorry to grave dig a bit, but I would like to say this works almost flawless, the only problem I am having right now is that when I enchant something, it takes away all off my runes. How would I stop that from happening? I looked the code up and down and couldn’t find what was going wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] jewlery enchanting & new crafting [pi] *fixed*
item.dc:creator: @Zosedan Zosedan
item.description:
@Zosedan wrote:

[quote=“360236, post:15, topic:427268”]Thanks for this great tutorial :). I tried adding it to my server but I had two issues. First, when I changed my craftHide void to yours I receive these errors:

src\server\model\players\skills\Crafting.java:95: error: cannot find symbol AmountToD = craftType; ^ symbol: variable AmountToD location: class Crafting src\server\model\players\skills\Crafting.java:97: error: cannot find symbol c.sendMessage("you need "+AmountToD+" pieces of leather to craft this."); ^ symbol: variable AmountToD location: class Crafting src\server\model\players\skills\Crafting.java:100: error: cannot find symbol AmountToD--; ^ symbol: variable AmountToD location: class Crafting src\server\model\players\skills\Crafting.java:101: error: cannot find symbol if (AmountToD > 0) ^ symbol: variable AmountToD location: class Crafting src\server\model\players\skills\Crafting.java:103: error: cannot find symbol AmountToD--; ^ symbol: variable AmountToD location: class Crafting src\server\model\players\skills\Crafting.java:104: error: cannot find symbol if (AmountToD > 0) ^ symbol: variable AmountToD location: class Crafting src\server\model\players\skills\Crafting.java:106: error: cannot find symbol AmountToD--; ^ symbol: variable AmountToD location: class Crafting Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 7 errors Press any key to continue . . .

I tried fixing this, but failed. So I just kept my old craftHide void. Since I kept my old craftHide void, Dhide no longer crafts.

My second issue is it seems anything that has to do with smithing interface/crafting interface does not work. For example:

This is the same for my Smithing interface. I had this issue with my smithing interface before I did this tutorial.[/quote]

You never declared the AmountToD variable.

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] jewlery enchanting & new crafting [pi] *fixed*
item.description:
@360236 wrote:

Thanks for this great tutorial :). I tried adding it to my server but I had two issues. First, when I changed my craftHide void to yours I receive these errors:

src\server\model\players\skills\Crafting.java:95: error: cannot find symbol AmountToD = craftType; ^ symbol: variable AmountToD location: class Crafting src\server\model\players\skills\Crafting.java:97: error: cannot find symbol c.sendMessage("you need "+AmountToD+" pieces of leather to craft this."); ^ symbol: variable AmountToD location: class Crafting src\server\model\players\skills\Crafting.java:100: error: cannot find symbol AmountToD--; ^ symbol: variable AmountToD location: class Crafting src\server\model\players\skills\Crafting.java:101: error: cannot find symbol if (AmountToD > 0) ^ symbol: variable AmountToD location: class Crafting src\server\model\players\skills\Crafting.java:103: error: cannot find symbol AmountToD--; ^ symbol: variable AmountToD location: class Crafting src\server\model\players\skills\Crafting.java:104: error: cannot find symbol if (AmountToD > 0) ^ symbol: variable AmountToD location: class Crafting src\server\model\players\skills\Crafting.java:106: error: cannot find symbol AmountToD--; ^ symbol: variable AmountToD location: class Crafting Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 7 errors Press any key to continue . . .

I tried fixing this, but failed. So I just kept my old craftHide void. Since I kept my old craftHide void, Dhide no longer crafts.

My second issue is it seems anything that has to do with smithing interface/crafting interface does not work. For example:

This is the same for my Smithing interface. I had this issue with my smithing interface before I did this tutorial.

Read full topic
